page.title: 19CLUBS-ARTS AND CRAFTS
page.content:
AMANDA BRITTAN,AGED TWELVE,TALKS ABOUT THIS GREAT HORKESLEY CLUB.
I USED TO GO TO AN ART CLUB EVERY WEDNESDAY AT 50 KEELERS WAY.IT WAS FROM 4 OCLOCK UNTIL A QUARTER PAST FIVE.I USED TO GO HOME FROM SCHOOL, CHANGE AND MEET SUZANNE,A FRIEND OF MINE WHO ALSO WENT TO THE CLUB. AT THE CLUB WE COULD TAKE OUR OWN PAINTS,OR USE THOSE BELONGING TO THE TEACHER,A LADY CALLED JILL.WE HAD TO PICK A PICTURE,THEN TRY TO DRAW IT ON A PIECE OF ROUGH PAPER.WE WOULD THEN PAINT IT ON A GOOD PIECE OF PAPER,AND WE WOULD SOMETIMES USE SOME QUITE GOOD WATER PAINTS.JILL WOULD HELP US A LOT WITH OUR PAINTING,AND SHE WOULD ALWAYS TELL US HOW GOOD IT WAS,EVEN IF WE KNEW IT REALLY WAS'NT THAT GOOD AT ALL.WE ALWAYS TOOK THE PAINTINGS HOME.
